zone.line: To Minerva 28.
I sing the glorious Power with azure eyes
tameless
Athenian Pallas, savage, chaste, & wise,
preserving
Trilogenia, town destroying Maid,
Revered & mighty; from his awful head
Whom Jove brought forth in warlike armor
o strange drest
Golden, all radient. . wonder mute possessed
The everlasting Gods that shape to see
Shaking a javelin keen, impetuously
Rush from the crest of agis bearing Jove:
Fearfully Heaven was shaken & did move
Beneath the might of the Cerulean eyed
Earth dreadfully resounded, far & wide
And lifted from its depths, the
Sea swelled high
In purple billows, the tide suddenly
Stood still, & great Hyperions Son long time
